figure.caption: Figure 274. Standard and Forward Position "X" Bar

note.para: The standard position "X" bar top cover assembly and the forward position "X" bar top cover assembly use different covers. The forward cover also uses a plate and a gasket installed over the detent balls and springs.

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts of the top cover with the oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Clean the threads of the fasteners with Loctite Safety Solvent #755 or equivalent. Make sure all dirt is removed from the threads.

note.para: Refer to the specifications of the sealant manufacturer for "cure" time.

step1.para: Apply Loctite #242 or equivalent to the threads of the fasteners.
Put the low-reverse fork in a vise with brass jaws.
Install the ball and spring in the bore next to the plunger.
Install the plunger and spring in the bore of the fork (Figure 276).
Install the snap ring that holds the assembly in the fork.
Install the guide pin through the rocking lever (Figure 277).

figure.caption: Figure 277. Install Guide Pin Through Rocking Lever

step1.para: Install spacer washer on the guide pin.

caution.para: Install the O-ring on the guide pin after installing the rocking lever and spacer plate or the O-ring will be damaged.

step1.para: Install a new O-ring on the guide pin.
Install the assembly so that the long part of the spacer plate is toward the center of the housing.
Install a new nut and new washer that fasten the guide pin to the housing. Tighten to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.

Put the low-reverse shift shaft in the bottom bore in the rear of the housing (Figure 278). Make sure the two detent grooves are toward the rear of the housing. Make sure the detent grooves in the shaft are aligned with the detent ball holes in the housing.

figure.caption: Figure 278. Put Low-Reverse Shift Shaft in Bottom Bore

step1.para: Put the low-reverse shift fork assembly in the housing so that the lower lever slot is toward the center of the assembly. Make sure the bore of the fork is aligned with the bore in the housing.
Push the shift shaft through the fork and sleeve assembly until the holes in the fork and shaft are aligned.

caution.para: After the set screws with the Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the bolts may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screw with the Loctite sealant that fastens the fork in position on the shaft. Tighten the set screws to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the set screw and the fork assembly.

Install the neutral check shaft in the bore on the top of the housing. Make sure the round end of the shaft is installed toward the low-reverse shift rail. Make sure the end of the shaft touches the slot in the rail (Figure 279).
Put the large interlock ball in the bottom of the middle bore of the first set of bores on the rear of the housing ( Figure 280).

figure.caption: Figure 280. Put Large Interlock Ball in Bottom of Middle Bore

note.para: The 1-2 shift shaft is the same size as the 3-4 shift shaft and has a hole drilled through the shaft.
Move the low-reverse shift shaft assembly so that the interlock ball is completely installed in the bore. Move the low-reverse shaft assembly so that the 1-2 shaft can be installed.

step1.para: Put the 1-2 shift shaft in the middle bore of the housing. Make sure the part identification on the end of the shaft is toward the front of the housing. Make sure the detent grooves in the shaft are aligned with the detent ball holes ( Figure 281).

Put the 1-2 shift sleeve in the housing. Make sure the bore of the sleeve is aligned with the bore in the housing. Make sure the threaded hole in the sleeve is toward the rear of the housing (Figure 281).
Push the shift shaft through the 1-2 shift sleeve ( Figure 281).

figure.caption: Figure 281. Push Shift Shaft Through 1-2 Shift Sleeve

step1.para: Put the 1-2 shift fork in the housing. Make sure bend on the fork is installed toward the middle set of bores. Make sure the bore of the fork is aligned with the bore in the housing (Figure 281).
Push the shift shaft through the 1-2 fork until the holes in the fork and the sleeve are aligned with the holes in the shaft ( Figure 281).

caution.para: After the set screws with Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the set screws may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screws with the Loctite sealant that fastens the 1-2 fork and the sleeve to the rail. Tighten the set screws to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the set screws and the fork and sleeve. Wrap the lock wire around the barrel of the shaft.
Put the interlock pin in the hole drilled in the end of the 1-2 shift shaft (Figure 282).

figure.caption: Figure 282. Put Interlock Pin in Hole Drilled in End of 1-2 Shift Shaft

step1.para: Put the interlock ball in the bottom of the top bore of the first set of bores at the rear of the housing ( Figure 283).

figure.caption: Figure 283. Put Interlock Ball in Bottom of Top Bore

step1.para: Makes sure the low-reverse sleeve and the 1-2 sleeve are in the NEUTRAL position. The slots in the sleeve must be aligned.

note.para: On R-ratio transmissions, the bill of material refers to the 3-4 shift fork as the O/D (Overdrive) shift fork and the 3-4 "X" bar sleeve as the O/D shift sleeve.

step1.para: Assemble the 3-4 shift sleeve and the shaft assembly.

note.para: The 3-4 shift sleeve shaft has a slot on one side.
Move the 1-2 shift shaft assembly so that the interlock ball is completely installed in the bore. Move the 1-2 shaft assembly so that the 3-4 shift sleeve shaft can be installed.

step1.para: Put the 3-4 shift sleeve shaft in the top bore of the housing. Make sure the interlock slot on the end of the shaft is toward the rear of the housing. Make sure the detent grooves in the shaft are aligned with the detent ball holes in the housing ( Figure 284).

Put the 3-4 shift sleeve in the housing. Make sure the bore of the sleeve is aligned with the bore in the housing. Make sure the slot in the 3-4 shift sleeve is aligned with the slot in the 1-2 sleeve (Figure 284).

figure.caption: Figure 284. Push Shift Shaft Through 3-4 Shift Sleeve

step1.para: Push the shift shaft through the 3-4 shift sleeve.

Put the 3-4 "X" bar sleeve in the housing. Make sure the slot in the sleeve is aligned over the rocking lever assembly. Make sure the bore of the sleeve is aligned with the bore in the housing (Figure 284).
Push the shift shaft through the 3-4 "X" bar sleeve until the holes in the sleeves are aligned with the holes in the shaft.

caution.para: After the set screws with Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the set screws may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screws with the Loctite sealant that fastens the sleeves to the shaft. Tighten the set screws to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the sleeves and set screws.

note.para: On R-ratio transmissions, the bill of material refers to the 3-4 shift fork as the O/D (Overdrive) shift fork and the 3-4 "X" bar sleeve as the O/D shift sleeve.

step1.para: Put the 3-4 shift fork shaft in the top bore at the front of the housing ( Figure 285).

Put the 3-4 shift fork in the housing. Make sure slot on the fork is aligned with the rocking lever assembly. Makes sure the bore of the fork and sleeve assembly is aligned with the bore of the housing (Figure 285).

figure.caption: Figure 285. Put 3-4 Shift Fork in Housing

step1.para: Push the shift shaft through the 3-4 fork.

caution.para: After the set screws with Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the set screws may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screw with the Loctite sealant that fastens the 3-4 fork to the shaft. Tighten the set screw to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the set screws and fork
If removed, install the large and small oil scoops on the housing. Install and tighten the bolts with the Loctite sealant to 14 to 18 Nm (10 to 13 ft-lbs.) ( Figure 286).

note.para: On standard position top cover assemblies, one or two reverse switches may be used. On forward position top covers, one reverse switch is used.

step1.para: Install the larger pin(s) in the bore(s) for the reverse lamp switch. Install the switches or plugs and tighten to 47 to 68 Nm (35 to 50 ft-lbs.) ( Figure 287).

figure.caption: Figure 287. Install Larger Pin in Bore

step1.para: Install the short pin in the bore for the neutral safety switch. Install the switch or plug and tighten to 47 to 68 Nm (35 to 50 ft-lbs) (Figure 288).
Install the breather vent in the top cover. Tighten to 20 to 27 Nm (15 to 20 ft-lbs) ( Figure 288).

figure.caption: Figure 288. Install Short Pin and Breather Vent
